intro: Koanophyllon potosinum, commonly known as the Potosí grass, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, high-altitude environments, thriving in the dry and cold conditions of the Andean region. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Koanophyllon potosinum is adapted to extreme climates and plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
